metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10858 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-buffer overflow was found in the way samba clients processed extra long filename in a directory listing. A malicious samba server could use this flaw to cause arbitrary code execution on a samba client. Samba versions before 4.6.16, 4.7.9 and 4.8.4 are vulnerable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.16').
